text: The Christian Social Party (; PSC) is a center-right political party in Ecuador. The party was founded in 1951 under the name of Social Christian Movement (Movimiento Social Cristiano) by Camilo Ponce Enríquez, who was Ecuador's president from 1956 to 1960, and Sixto Durán Ballén. It was initially focused on Quito. ==Other websites== *Official website Category:1951 establishments in South America Category:Political parties of Ecuador
title: Christian Social Party (Ecuador)
